intro: Euphrasia insignis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed eyebright, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers with prominent white markings, which are often mistaken for eyes, giving it its common name. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it is often found in clusters along the ground. Euphrasia insignis is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies for various ailments.
